column8: What you referred to as resentment was a product of ignorance of the nature of the project, its history of abandonment and the attitude of the original contractor. The contract for the building of a befitting secretariat was awarded in 2012 by the Dakingari administration at an initial cost of just over N3 billion. The project suffered some delays and some years after, the contractor asked for a review of the cost to about N7 billion. It dragged on until Nasir Idris became governor and inherited it. Its completion was one of the cardinal electioneering campaign promises of the governor. When he won, he went for it and asked the original contractor to make submissions of what it will take to complete it. To our chagrin, the contractors made a staggering costing of N21 billion. The government flatly rejected it and decided to revoke it. When the contracting company was announced government's intention to revoke the contract, it sat well with them. So, it was revoked and two reputable indigenous companies made a joint submission of N10 billion to complete it and the government, seeing the advantages, awarded the contract to them. We are talking about halving the cost and getting it finished in 18 months. So, it beats me how anybody would raise eyebrows or cry wolf where none exists.

Auglýsing um byggingu skrifskrifstofu var samþykktur árið 2012 af ríkisstjórn Dakingari á upp á N3 Málið dróist út í lengið þar til Nasir Nasir varð landstjóri og erfði hana. column8: As the plot thickens in Asteroid City, the framing of the film falls away. We know we are watching a fake play, but it is presented in a three-dimensional space, making use of cinematic techniques, and it feels as real as anything else in an Anderson film. But then everything comes to a head. Everyone is gathered in the crater, with a cardboard box over their head so that they can witness an astrological ellipsis - in which the sun, the moon, and the Milky Way line up along a single plane. Dr. Hickenlooper explains how it works: "What you are going to see is a very simple dot, dot, dot." But after the three dots, a fourth appears, glowing green, and it grows closer until it becomes, clearly, a flying saucer. It hovers over the crater and sheds a green light over everything. A spindly extraterrestrial descends on the ceremony and departs with the meteor, leaving all the observers stunned. End of Act I.
column9: Þegar söguþráðurinn þykknar í smástirnaborginni fellur umgjörð myndarinnar niður. Við vitum að við erum að horfa á falsað leikrit, en það er sett fram í þrívíðu rými, sem nýtir kvikmyndatækni, og það virkar eins raunverulegt og allt annað í Anderson-mynd. En svo kemur allt upp á yfirborðið. Allir eru samankomnir í gígnum, með pappakassa yfir höfðinu svo að þeir geti orðið vitni að stjörnuspeki – þar sem sólin, tunglið og Vetrarbrautin raðast upp á einu plani. Dr. Hickenlooper útskýrir hvernig það virkar: „Það sem þú ert að fara að sjá er mjög einfaldur punktur, punktur, punktur.“ En eftir punktana þrjá birtist sá fjórði, glóandi grænn, og hann vex nær þar til hann verður greinilega að fljúgandi undirskál. Hún svífur yfir gígnum og varpar grænu ljósi yfir allt. Spindrandi geimvera stígur niður á athöfnina og leggur af stað með loftsteininum og allir áhorfendurnir verða agndofa. Í lok I. þáttar.

column8: What is more, there is an increasingly bewildering range of CDR technologies on offer. Some will doubtless fall by the wayside. But few in the field expect a single technology to become dominant in the way that silicon photovoltaics have. This is in some ways a good thing - different technologies will allow different sorts of application in different situations. But doubling the installed capacity of each of ten separate technologies just once gets you much less by way of savings than doubling the installed capacity of one technology ten times in a row.

column8: The border between worldly and otherworldly is porous here. After only five seconds of human activity at the start of the play, Death shows up - or really a psychopomp, that folkloric being, known to many cultures, that collects the souls of the recently deceased to lead them to the afterlife. Jacobs-Jenkins renders him as a wry, friendly figure who occasionally takes over the bodies of the other characters to explain what is happening beneath their jabber. (I say "him" because the first body he inhabits is male.) The rest of the time, he watches and waits, invisibly playing the long or short game, wanting to know his customers before they buy the farm.
column9: Mörkin milli hins veraldlega og hins yfirnáttúrulega eru gljúp hér. column8: In my brief but intensive experience as a restaurant-going parent, I've learned the advantages of bringing the right tools: a waterproof placemat for the baby, a bib with a little pocket for catching dropped food, and a spill-proof sippy cup to avoid water hazards, plus the usual arsenal of face wipes and baby utensils and formula and a bottle and a replacement bottle and peanut-butter puffs and yogurt pouches and board books and stuffed toys and diapers and changes of clothes. But you can also get away with bringing absolutely nothing, especially if you're willing to just hand the baby a giant hunk of bread and let her go to town while you contemplate your Martini. The one at Gus's, by the way, made with a blend of two gins and two vermouths, is subtle and complex, on the genteelly small side, and served in a frost-kissed coupe. (I didn't get to try the hunk of bread, but the babies at the table seemed to approve.) There are no rules to Baby Hour, beyond the standard ones of conscientious restaurant patronage: be kind to your servers, apologize for your mess, and tip extravagantly. ♦

Það eru engar reglur um Baby Hour, umfram venjulegar reglur um samviskusaman veitingastað: vertu góður við netþjóna þína, biðstu afsökunar á óreiðu þinni og þjórfé. ♦

column8: Arriving in the United States was traumatic and shocking. At the time, there was very little help for me to navigate school, especially without knowing the language or the culture. It was "sink or swim" and initially I simply drowned. I was bullied and beaten by girls my age because I was a foreigner. Because I didn't speak English I was an easy target. I had no curse words that I could shout back at them. They would surround me in a circle and yell, spit, pull my hair and punch me. I stood there frozen. Frozen but brave - no tears.

Það var „synda eða synda“ og í upphafi drukknaði ég einfaldlega. Ég var lagður í einelti og barinn af stelpum á mínum aldri vegna þess að ég var útlendingur. column8: Italian anti-Mafia police said there are still four major mafiosi in hiding, and several lesser figures on the run. The Italian government anti-Mafia website lists the top four. Pasquale Bonavota, 48, has been on the run since 2018 and has been convicted of Mafia crimes related to the Calabrian "Ndrangheta. Giovanni Motisi, 64, a member of the Sicilian Cosa Nostra, has been on the run since 1998 when he was convicted of murder and Mafia association in Sicily. Renato Cinquegranella of the Neapolitan Camorra, 73, has been on the run since 2002, after being convicted of murder, weapons charges and extortion, and Attilio Cubeddu, 75, has been on the run since 1997, convicted of multiple kidnapping charges and is considered one of Italy's most dangerous fugitives.

Ítalska ríkisstjórnartekju máfíuvarslónum birtir fjögur helstu máfíósamenn. Pasquale Bonavota, 48 ára, hefur verið á lópum síðan árið 2018 og er dómlaður fyrir glæpi máfíu sem tengjast Calabrian "Ndrangheta. Giovanni Motisi, 64 ára, sem er meðlima sicilskrar Cosa Nostra, hefur verið á lópum síðan árið 1998 þegar hann var dómlaður fyrir morði og máfíutengsl í Sícilíu. Renato Cinquegranella, 73 ára, sem er meðlimi neapolskrar Camorra, hefur verið á lópum síðan 2002, eftir að hafa verið dómlaður fyrir morð, vapnaþjófnað og ofskurðarefni, en Attilio Cubeddu, 75 ára, hefur verið á lópum síðan 1997 og er dómlaður fyrir marga þjófnaði og er telður einu mesta fjárhreinsgælumálmæli Ítalíu.

"I wanted to find a name for the album that encompassed the energy of what the songs are doing," he mapped out in the air. "Ruckus! is meant to stir people up. And this record, in particular, is quite different to anything we've done in the past. Although I don't think that it doesn't sound like Movements - I think at its core, it still does. There's a new kind of energy that's in your face."

column8: What you referred to as resentment was a product of ignorance of the nature of the project, its history of abandonment and the attitude of the original contractor. The contract for the building of a befitting secretariat was awarded in 2012 by the Dakingari administration at an initial cost of just over N3 billion. The project suffered some delays and some years after, the contractor asked for a review of the cost to about N7 billion. It dragged on until Nasir Idris became governor and inherited it. Its completion was one of the cardinal electioneering campaign promises of the governor. When he won, he went for it and asked the original contractor to make submissions of what it will take to complete it. To our chagrin, the contractors made a staggering costing of N21 billion. The government flatly rejected it and decided to revoke it. When the contracting company was announced government's intention to revoke the contract, it sat well with them. So, it was revoked and two reputable indigenous companies made a joint submission of N10 billion to complete it and the government, seeing the advantages, awarded the contract to them. We are talking about halving the cost and getting it finished in 18 months. So, it beats me how anybody would raise eyebrows or cry wolf where none exists.
column9: Það sem þú nefndir gremju var afleiðing vanþekkingar á eðli verkefnisins, sögu þess að því væri hafnað og viðhorfum upphaflega verktakans. Samningur um byggingu viðeigandi skrifstofuhúsnæðis var veittur árið 2012 af stjórn Dakingari og upphaflegur kostnaður var örlítið yfir N3 milljarður. Framkvæmdunum seinkaði nokkuð og nokkrum árum síðar bað verktakinn um endurskoðun á kostnaðinum upp á um N7 milljarða. Verkefnið dróst á langinn þangað til Nasir Idris varð landstjóri og erfði það. Að ljúka verkinu var eitt af helstu loforðunum sem landstjórinn gaf fyrir kosningar. Þegar hann sigraði tók hann málið upp aftur og bað upphaflega verktakann um tillögur að því hvað þyrfti til að ljúka því. Það kom okkur hins vegar sárlega á óvart að verktakarnir áætluðu kostnað upp á N21 milljarð. Ríkisstjórnin hafnaði því alfarið og ákvað að rifta samningnum. Þegar verktaka fyrirtækinu var tilkynnt um áform ríkisstjórnarinnar um að rifta samningnum, þá tók það því vel. Þess vegna var samningurinn riftur og tvö álitin innlend fyrirtæki sendu inn sameiginlega tilboð um N10 milljarða til að ljúka verkefninu og ríkisstjórnin, sem sá kostina við það, veitti þeim verkefnið. Við ræðum um að helminga kostnaðinn og klára verkið á 18 mánuðum. Þess vegna skil ég ekki hvernig einhver gæti sett spurningarmerki við þetta eða kallað til úlfur þegar engir eru til staðar.

column8: As the plot thickens in Asteroid City, the framing of the film falls away. We know we are watching a fake play, but it is presented in a three-dimensional space, making use of cinematic techniques, and it feels as real as anything else in an Anderson film. But then everything comes to a head. Everyone is gathered in the crater, with a cardboard box over their head so that they can witness an astrological ellipsis - in which the sun, the moon, and the Milky Way line up along a single plane. Dr. Hickenlooper explains how it works: "What you are going to see is a very simple dot, dot, dot." But after the three dots, a fourth appears, glowing green, and it grows closer until it becomes, clearly, a flying saucer. It hovers over the crater and sheds a green light over everything. A spindly extraterrestrial descends on the ceremony and departs with the meteor, leaving all the observers stunned. End of Act I.
column9: Þegar söguþráðurinn í Asteroid City þykknar hverfur rammi kvikmyndarinnar. Við vitum að við horfum á falsað leikrit, en það er sett upp í þrívíddarrými, þar sem kvikmyndatækni er notuð, og það virðist jafn raunverulegt og allt annað í kvikmynd eftir Anderson. En svo fer allt á flug. Allir eru saman komnir í gígnum, með pappakassa yfir höfði sér, svo að þeir geti séð stjörnufræðilega sólmyrkvun - þar sem sólin, tunglið og Vetrarbrautin raða sér upp á eina línu. Dr. Hickenlooper útskýrir hvernig þetta virkar: „Það sem þið eruð að fara að sjá eru einfaldlega punktur, punktur, punktur.“ En eftir að hafa séð þrjá punkta birtist fjórði punkturinn, grænn á lit, og hann stækkar þangað til að það verður ljóst að það er fljúgandi furðuhlutur. Hann svífur yfir gígnum og varpar grænu ljósi á allt í kring. Sérkennilegt geimvera kemur niður á athöfnina og fer með loftsteininn og skilur áhorfendur eftir agndofa. Lok fyrsta þáttar.

column8: In my brief but intensive experience as a restaurant-going parent, I've learned the advantages of bringing the right tools: a waterproof placemat for the baby, a bib with a little pocket for catching dropped food, and a spill-proof sippy cup to avoid water hazards, plus the usual arsenal of face wipes and baby utensils and formula and a bottle and a replacement bottle and peanut-butter puffs and yogurt pouches and board books and stuffed toys and diapers and changes of clothes. But you can also get away with bringing absolutely nothing, especially if you're willing to just hand the baby a giant hunk of bread and let her go to town while you contemplate your Martini. The one at Gus's, by the way, made with a blend of two gins and two vermouths, is subtle and complex, on the genteelly small side, and served in a frost-kissed coupe. (I didn't get to try the hunk of bread, but the babies at the table seemed to approve.) There are no rules to Baby Hour, beyond the standard ones of conscientious restaurant patronage: be kind to your servers, apologize for your mess, and tip extravagantly. ♦

column8: Italian anti-Mafia police said there are still four major mafiosi in hiding, and several lesser figures on the run. The Italian government anti-Mafia website lists the top four. Pasquale Bonavota, 48, has been on the run since 2018 and has been convicted of Mafia crimes related to the Calabrian "Ndrangheta. Giovanni Motisi, 64, a member of the Sicilian Cosa Nostra, has been on the run since 1998 when he was convicted of murder and Mafia association in Sicily. Renato Cinquegranella of the Neapolitan Camorra, 73, has been on the run since 2002, after being convicted of murder, weapons charges and extortion, and Attilio Cubeddu, 75, has been on the run since 1997, convicted of multiple kidnapping charges and is considered one of Italy's most dangerous fugitives.

Á ítalskri vefsíðu yfirvalda gegn mafíunni má finna lista yfir fjóra efstu mafíuforingjana. Pasquale Bonavota, 48 ára, hefur verið á flótta frá árinu 2018 og hefur verið dæmdur fyrir mafíuglæpi í tengslum við calabrískt „Ndrangheta-glæpasamtök. Giovanni Motisi, 64 ára, er meðlimur í sikilíensku Cosa Nostra-samtökunum. Hann hefur verið á flótta frá árinu 1998 þegar hann var sakfelldur fyrir morð og fyrir að tengjast mafíunni á Sikiley. Renato Cinquegranella, úr Napolí-mafíunni, sem er 73 ára, hefur verið á flótta frá árinu 2002, eftir að hafa verið dæmdur fyrir morð, vopnalagabrot og fjárkúgun. column8: What you referred to as resentment was a product of ignorance of the nature of the project, its history of abandonment and the attitude of the original contractor. The contract for the building of a befitting secretariat was awarded in 2012 by the Dakingari administration at an initial cost of just over N3 billion. The project suffered some delays and some years after, the contractor asked for a review of the cost to about N7 billion. It dragged on until Nasir Idris became governor and inherited it. Its completion was one of the cardinal electioneering campaign promises of the governor. When he won, he went for it and asked the original contractor to make submissions of what it will take to complete it. To our chagrin, the contractors made a staggering costing of N21 billion. The government flatly rejected it and decided to revoke it. When the contracting company was announced government's intention to revoke the contract, it sat well with them. So, it was revoked and two reputable indigenous companies made a joint submission of N10 billion to complete it and the government, seeing the advantages, awarded the contract to them. We are talking about halving the cost and getting it finished in 18 months. So, it beats me how anybody would raise eyebrows or cry wolf where none exists.
column9: Það sem þú vísaðir til sem óánægju var afurð ókunnunar um náttúru verkefnisins, sögu yfirgefndar og viðhorf upprunalegs verkfræðinga. Samningur um byggingu viðeigandi ráðstjórnarhúss var veittur árið 2012 af stjórn Dakingari á upphaflegum kostnaði aðeins yfir 3 milljarða nairur. Verkefnið þjáðist af verkföllum og sumum árum síðar, bað verkfræðingur um endurskoðun kostnaðar upp í um 7 milljarða nairur. Það hélt áfram þar til Nasir Idris varð landstjóri og arfleiddi það. Lokið var ein af helstu kosningaloforðum landstjórans. Þegar hann sigraði, fór hann að því og bað upprunalegan verkfræðing að leggja fram tillögur um hvað það yrði að kostnaði að ljúka því. Til okkar óánægju, gerði verkfræðingur ótrúlega kostnaðarútreikninga upp í 21 milljarða nairur. Ríkið hafnaði því flatly og ákvað að ráða það úr gildi. Þegar verkfræðingafélagið var tilkynnt um áform ríkisins að ráða samningnum úr gildi, það sætti þeim vel. Þannig var samningurinn ráðaður úr gildi og tveir ábyrgir innlendar fyrirtæki gerðu sameiginlega tillögu upp í 10 milljarða nairur að ljúka því og ríkið, sjáandi kostnaðarýsin, veitti þeim samninginn. Við talmum um að halda kostnaðinum og ljúka því í 18 mánuði. Þannig er mér óskiljanlegt hvernig einhver geti reist augabrún eða grát í því sem engin er.

column8: As the plot thickens in Asteroid City, the framing of the film falls away. We know we are watching a fake play, but it is presented in a three-dimensional space, making use of cinematic techniques, and it feels as real as anything else in an Anderson film. But then everything comes to a head. Everyone is gathered in the crater, with a cardboard box over their head so that they can witness an astrological ellipsis - in which the sun, the moon, and the Milky Way line up along a single plane. Dr. Hickenlooper explains how it works: "What you are going to see is a very simple dot, dot, dot." But after the three dots, a fourth appears, glowing green, and it grows closer until it becomes, clearly, a flying saucer. It hovers over the crater and sheds a green light over everything. A spindly extraterrestrial descends on the ceremony and departs with the meteor, leaving all the observers stunned. End of Act I.
column9: Þegar áfundin nækva í Asteroide City, fjarlægist ramma myndbandsins. En síðan ná allt að hnitinu. Allir eru sameiginlegir í kratri, með pappakassi yfir höfðum þeirra svo að þeir geti vitnið yfirlýsingu á tölvupósti - þar sem sólin, tunglinu og Mjólkurveðurin líða upp á eina velli. Dr. Hickenlooper útskýrir hvernig það virkar: "Þú munt sjá mjög einfaldan punkt, punkt, punkt." En eftir þrjá punkta birtist fjórði, að glíma grænn, og hann nær nærri þar til að hann verður, auðvitað, flugskál. Það fluttar yfir kratann og skín grænt ljós yfir allt. column8: The border between worldly and otherworldly is porous here. After only five seconds of human activity at the start of the play, Death shows up - or really a psychopomp, that folkloric being, known to many cultures, that collects the souls of the recently deceased to lead them to the afterlife. Jacobs-Jenkins renders him as a wry, friendly figure who occasionally takes over the bodies of the other characters to explain what is happening beneath their jabber. (I say "him" because the first body he inhabits is male.) The rest of the time, he watches and waits, invisibly playing the long or short game, wanting to know his customers before they buy the farm.

column8: In my brief but intensive experience as a restaurant-going parent, I've learned the advantages of bringing the right tools: a waterproof placemat for the baby, a bib with a little pocket for catching dropped food, and a spill-proof sippy cup to avoid water hazards, plus the usual arsenal of face wipes and baby utensils and formula and a bottle and a replacement bottle and peanut-butter puffs and yogurt pouches and board books and stuffed toys and diapers and changes of clothes. But you can also get away with bringing absolutely nothing, especially if you're willing to just hand the baby a giant hunk of bread and let her go to town while you contemplate your Martini. The one at Gus's, by the way, made with a blend of two gins and two vermouths, is subtle and complex, on the genteelly small side, and served in a frost-kissed coupe. (I didn't get to try the hunk of bread, but the babies at the table seemed to approve.) There are no rules to Baby Hour, beyond the standard ones of conscientious restaurant patronage: be kind to your servers, apologize for your mess, and tip extravagantly. ♦

column8: Italian anti-Mafia police said there are still four major mafiosi in hiding, and several lesser figures on the run. The Italian government anti-Mafia website lists the top four. Pasquale Bonavota, 48, has been on the run since 2018 and has been convicted of Mafia crimes related to the Calabrian "Ndrangheta. Giovanni Motisi, 64, a member of the Sicilian Cosa Nostra, has been on the run since 1998 when he was convicted of murder and Mafia association in Sicily. Renato Cinquegranella of the Neapolitan Camorra, 73, has been on the run since 2002, after being convicted of murder, weapons charges and extortion, and Attilio Cubeddu, 75, has been on the run since 1997, convicted of multiple kidnapping charges and is considered one of Italy's most dangerous fugitives.
column9: Íslensku andófastlögreglunni gegn mafíunni hefur verið tjáð að fjórir aðalmafíumenn séu enn á flótta og nokkrir minni málaserkar. Opinber vefur ítalska stjórnarráðsins gegn mafíunni birtir þá fjóra efstu. Pasquale Bonavota, 48 ára, hefur verið á flótta síðan 2018 og hefur verið fundinn sekur um mafíuglæpi er tengjast Ndrangheta-mafíunni í Kalabríu. Giovanni Motisi, 64 ára, sem er meðlimur í Cosa Nostra-mafíunni á Sikiley, hefur verið á flótta síðan 1998 þegar hann var fundinn sekur um morð og mafíutengingar á Sikiley. Renato Cinquegranella úr Neapólismafíunni Camorra, 73 ára, hefur verið á flótta síðan 2002, eftir að hafa verið fundinn sekur um morð, vopnalagabrot og fjárkúgun. Attilio Cubeddu, 75 ára, hefur verið á flótta síðan 1997, fundinn sekur um fjölda mannránstilrauna og er talinn einn hættulegasti flóttamaðurinn í Ítalíu.

column8: What you referred to as resentment was a product of ignorance of the nature of the project, its history of abandonment and the attitude of the original contractor. The contract for the building of a befitting secretariat was awarded in 2012 by the Dakingari administration at an initial cost of just over N3 billion. The project suffered some delays and some years after, the contractor asked for a review of the cost to about N7 billion. It dragged on until Nasir Idris became governor and inherited it. Its completion was one of the cardinal electioneering campaign promises of the governor. When he won, he went for it and asked the original contractor to make submissions of what it will take to complete it. To our chagrin, the contractors made a staggering costing of N21 billion. The government flatly rejected it and decided to revoke it. When the contracting company was announced government's intention to revoke the contract, it sat well with them. So, it was revoked and two reputable indigenous companies made a joint submission of N10 billion to complete it and the government, seeing the advantages, awarded the contract to them. We are talking about halving the cost and getting it finished in 18 months. So, it beats me how anybody would raise eyebrows or cry wolf where none exists.
column9: Það sem þú nefndir gremju var afurð vanþekkingar á eðli verkefnisins, sögu þess um yfirgefningu og afstöðu upprunalega verktakans. Samningur um byggingu viðeigandi skrifstofu var gerður árið 2012 af stjórn Dakingari með stofnkostnaði upp á rúmlega N3 milljarða. Verkið varð fyrir nokkrum töfum og nokkrum árum síðar óskaði verktakinn eftir endurskoðun á kostnaði upp á um 7 milljarða króna. Það dróst þar til Nasir Idris varð ríkisstjóri og erfði það. Uppfylling þess var eitt af kosningaloforðum ríkisstjórans. Þegar hann vann, fór hann í það og bað upprunalega verktakann að gera greinargerðir um hvað það þarf til að ljúka því. Okkur til skelfingar voru verktakarnir með svimandi kostnað upp á N21 milljarð. Ríkisstjórnin hafnaði því alfarið og ákvað að afturkalla það. Þegar verktakafyrirtækið var tilkynnt um áform ríkisstjórnarinnar um að afturkalla samninginn sat það vel með þeim. Svo var það afturkallað og tveir virtir frumbyggjar lögðu sameiginlega fram N10 milljarða til að ljúka því og ríkisstjórnin, sem sá kostina, gerði samninginn við þá. Við erum að tala um að lækka kostnaðinn um helming og klára það á 18 mánuðum. Það slær mig hvernig einhver myndi lyfta augabrúnum eða gráta úlf þar sem enginn er til.

idiomatic	the plot thickens	[['flækjast', 'l'], ['mál', 'l']]	[]			Rejected: No cues found in translation.	As the plot thickens in Asteroid City, the framing of the film falls away. We know we are watching a fake play, but it is presented in a three-dimensional space, making use of cinematic techniques, and it feels as real as anything else in an Anderson film. But then everything comes to a head. Everyone is gathered in the crater, with a cardboard box over their head so that they can witness an astrological ellipsis - in which the sun, the moon, and the Milky Way line up along a single plane. Dr. Hickenlooper explains how it works: What you are going to see is a very simple dot, dot, dot." But after the three dots, a fourth appears, glowing green, and it grows closer until it becomes, clearly, a flying saucer. It hovers over the crater and sheds a green light over everything. A spindly extraterrestrial descends on the ceremony and departs with the meteor, leaving all the observers stunned. End of Act I.
column10: Þegar söguþráðurinn þykknar upp í Asteroid City fellur innrömmun myndarinnar af. En svo kemur allt í hámæli. Dr. Hickenlooper útskýrir hvernig það virkar: "Það sem þú ætlar að sjá er mjög einfaldur punktur, punktur, punktur." column8: The border between worldly and otherworldly is porous here. After only five seconds of human activity at the start of the play, Death shows up - or really a psychopomp, that folkloric being, known to many cultures, that collects the souls of the recently deceased to lead them to the afterlife. Jacobs-Jenkins renders him as a wry, friendly figure who occasionally takes over the bodies of the other characters to explain what is happening beneath their jabber. (I say "him" because the first body he inhabits is male.) The rest of the time, he watches and waits, invisibly playing the long or short game, wanting to know his customers before they buy the farm.

column8: In my brief but intensive experience as a restaurant-going parent, I've learned the advantages of bringing the right tools: a waterproof placemat for the baby, a bib with a little pocket for catching dropped food, and a spill-proof sippy cup to avoid water hazards, plus the usual arsenal of face wipes and baby utensils and formula and a bottle and a replacement bottle and peanut-butter puffs and yogurt pouches and board books and stuffed toys and diapers and changes of clothes. But you can also get away with bringing absolutely nothing, especially if you're willing to just hand the baby a giant hunk of bread and let her go to town while you contemplate your Martini. The one at Gus's, by the way, made with a blend of two gins and two vermouths, is subtle and complex, on the genteelly small side, and served in a frost-kissed coupe. (I didn't get to try the hunk of bread, but the babies at the table seemed to approve.) There are no rules to Baby Hour, beyond the standard ones of conscientious restaurant patronage: be kind to your servers, apologize for your mess, and tip extravagantly. ♦
column9: Í mínu stutta en þéttu reynslu sem foreldri sem ferðast út í veitingastaði, hef ég lært að njóta ábyrgðar réttra verkfæra: vatnsþétt borðmát fyrir babban, skjóld með lítið fólk fyrir að gripa mat sem fellur, og spillþéttan kaffibikar til að forðast vatnshættur, auk venjulegs vopnabúr af andlitsvötum og babbaútbúnaði og fóðri og flöskum og viðbót flöskum og pínubitarpúsum og jogúrtapósum og borðbókum og dúkkuðum leikföngum og klúðum og breytingum fatnaðar. En það er einnig hægt að sleppa að taka ekkert með, sérstaklega ef þú ert villtur að láta babban fá stórt brauð og láta hana ganga á það meðan þú hugsar um Martini þitt. Það í Gus's, auk þess, gerð með blöndu tveggja ginna og tveggja vermoutha, er einfalt og flókið, á hinu lítilmennta hlið, og það er borðað í frostkissuðu coupe. (Ég fékk ekki að prófa brauðið, en babbanirnar við borðið sáu að vera ánægðar.) Það eru engin reglur um Babba-tímann, auk þeirra staðlaða sem varða umsjón veitingastaða: vera góður við þjónustufólk, biðja afsökunar fyrir óröðinni og gefa ríkan peninga. ♦

column8: Italian anti-Mafia police said there are still four major mafiosi in hiding, and several lesser figures on the run. The Italian government anti-Mafia website lists the top four. Pasquale Bonavota, 48, has been on the run since 2018 and has been convicted of Mafia crimes related to the Calabrian "Ndrangheta. Giovanni Motisi, 64, a member of the Sicilian Cosa Nostra, has been on the run since 1998 when he was convicted of murder and Mafia association in Sicily. Renato Cinquegranella of the Neapolitan Camorra, 73, has been on the run since 2002, after being convicted of murder, weapons charges and extortion, and Attilio Cubeddu, 75, has been on the run since 1997, convicted of multiple kidnapping charges and is considered one of Italy's most dangerous fugitives.

Vefur tíðastjórnar anti-mafíu Ítalía færir úr listann yfir fjórar stórar. Pasquale Bonavota, 48 ára, hefur verið á flugum síðan 2018 og hefur verið verðað um mafíusarverði ákvörðuð við að kaleytiskt „Ndrangheta í Calabrian. Giovanni Motisi, 64 ára, stóð með í sicilianskri Cosa Nostra, hefur verið á flugum síðan 1998 þegar hann var ákvörðuð um drepgöngu og samþyrpingu mafíusar í Sicíli. Renato Cinquegranella, 73, af neapolitansku Camorra, hefur verið á flugum síðan 2002, eftir að hafa verið ákvörðuð um drepgöngu, vopnaáætlum og úthreyingum, og Attilio Cubeddu, 75, hefur verið á flugum síðan 1997, ákvörðuð um margar áfangaðaðum og er fundinn sem aðeins einn af Ítalíusæsta flugmenn.

column8: Coolly lounged on a sofa in a London pub, hours before dominating a sold-out show at Camden's Underworld, Movements' singer and primary lyricist Patrick Miranda exclusively told Express.co.uk that Ruckus! came from a desire to shake things up for the band - and their fans. "I wanted to find a name for the album that encompassed the energy of what the songs are doing," he mapped out in the air. "Ruckus! is meant to stir people up. And this record, in particular, is quite different to anything we've done in the past. Although I don't think that it doesn't sound like Movements - I think at its core, it still does. There's a new kind of energy that's in your face."
column9: Þægilega látið á sófu í lóndonskum krá, klukkustundum áður en þeir ríktu yfir útsóluðu sýningu í Camden's Underworld, sagði Patrick Miranda, söngvari og aðaltextahöfundur Movements, einstaklega við Express.co.uk að Ruckus! komi frá því að skipta um hlutum fyrir hljómsveitina - og áhöfn þeirra. "Ég vildi finna nafn fyrir plötuna sem tæki inn andrúmsloftið í því sem lögurnar eru að gera," sagði hann og teiknaði í loftinu. "Ruckus! á að vekja fólk upp. Og þessi plata, í sérstaklega, er frekar ólík öllu því sem við höfum gert áður. Þó ég telji að hún hljómi ennþá eins og Movements - ég telji að í kjarna sínum hljómi hún ennþá eins. Það er nýtt slag af orku sem er beint í andlit."
